aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident in Santa Barbara, California
The accident occurred in Santa Barbara, California.
The accident occurred on January 11, 2020, at 20:10 Local time.
The accident involved a Piper PA28 aircraft.
The defining event of the accident was a ground collision.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Personal.
The accident number was WPR20CA087.
The aircraft registration was N8408E.
The Piper PA28 aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There were 2 occupants in the Piper PA28.
No injuries were reported in the accident.
The pilot received clearance to taxi from air traffic control.
The pilot proceeded to taxi onto what he thought was the centerline of the taxiway.
The accident occurred during nighttime conditions.
During the taxi, the Piper PA28 suddenly turned right.
The pilot stopped the Piper PA28 after it turned right.
The pilot thought something on the ground had made "the wheel turn."
The pilot looked at the right wing but noticed nothing abnormal.
After the Piper PA28 was airborne, the pilot saw that part of the right wingtip was separated.
The pilot continued the flight to his destination.
The pilot landed uneventfully at his destination.
Postaccident examination revealed the right wing of the Piper PA28 had sustained substantive structural damage.
A portion of the Piper PA28's right wingtip was found underneath a damaged wing on an unoccupied airplane.
The unoccupied airplane was parked adjacent to the taxiway.
The pilot reported no preaccident mechanical failures with the Piper PA28.
The pilot reported no preaccident malfunctions with the Piper PA28 that would have precluded normal operation.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of this accident to be the pilot's failure to maintain clearance from a parked airplane during taxi operations at night.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Santa Barbara, California

## Date & Time: 
January 11, 2020, 20:10 Local

## Aircraft:
Piper PA28

## Defining Event:
Ground collision

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Personal

## Accident Number:
WPR20CA087

## Registration:
N8408E

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
2 None

## Analysis

The pilot reported that, upon receiving clearance to taxi from air traffic control, he proceeded to taxi onto what he thought was the centerline of the taxiway in nighttime conditions. During the taxi, the airplane suddenly turned right. The pilot stopped the airplane and thought something on the ground had made "the wheel turn." He looked at the right wing but noticed nothing abnormal. After the airplane was airborne, the pilot saw that part of the right wingtip was separated. The pilot continued the flight and landed uneventfully at his destination. Postaccident examination of the airplane revealed that the right wing had sustained substantive structural damage. A portion of the airplane's right wingtip was found underneath a damaged wing on an unoccupied airplane that was parked adjacent to the taxiway. The pilot reported that there were no preaccident mechanical failures or malfunctions with the airplane that would have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The pilot's failure to maintain clearance from a parked airplane during taxi operations at night.

---
